meanings.definition: A person qualified to treat and care for animals.
meanings.sent1: The vet helped the injured puppy.
meanings.sent2: I took my cat to the vet for a check-up.
meanings.sent3: The vet and the parrot had a chat about the weather.
meanings.sent4: She was a vet of emotions, understanding each one deeply.
meanings.sent5: The vet's love for animals shone through in every action.

meanings.definition: To examine or treat an animal as a veterinarian.
meanings.sent1: The doctor will vet the horse before the race.
meanings.sent2: I need to vet this dog before it can be adopted.
meanings.sent3: The vetted cat proudly showed off its new collar.
meanings.sent4: She had to vet through a pile of paperwork before finding the right form.
meanings.sent5: He carefully vetted each patient, ensuring they received the best care.

meanings.definition: To carefully examine or investigate something.
meanings.sent1: I will vet the details of the contract before signing.
meanings.sent2: The team needs to vet the evidence thoroughly.
meanings.sent3: She decided to vet the mystery of the missing socks.
meanings.sent4: The detective vetted the alibi, searching for any inconsistencies.
meanings.sent5: He vetted the map, looking for the hidden treasure's location.
